result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnny Fletcher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Great Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all Court costs, assessments and fees in this action.  to be paid from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
*12/16/2015  Honorable Janet C. Protasiewicz-credit amended to 218 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with children under the age of 16 unless a parenting class has been completed and it is 
Not to possess weapons.

Successfully complete an anger management program.
Cooperate fully with probation agent.
AODA assessment.  Comply with treatment.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay the DNA surcharge during Extended Supervision or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Court ordered defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence; also advised that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnny Fletcher

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript of SENTENCE HEARING (36 pages) commencing NOVEMBER 6, 2015 received and filed.

Order Amending Judgment of Conviction, SIGNED AND FILED.

The defendant was arrested on April 2, 2015.  Sentence was imposed on November 6, 2015.  The defendant is entitled to a total of 218 days of credit for this period.  The judgment of conviction shall be amended accordingly and reported to the Department of Corrections.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, for review. mag
DOC request to review order for sentence credit.

Defendant Johnny Fletcher in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Johnny Fletcher in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements made as to sentencing.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 11 YEARS, with credit for 230 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 6 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  
.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program; is not eligible or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and comply with treatment.
-Successfully complete an anger management program.
-Random urine screens.
-No contact with children under the age of 16 unless a parenting class has been completed and it is 
-Possess no weapons.
-Cooperate fully with probation agent.
-Maintain employment.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and fees in this action during period of Extended Supervision, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
.
Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during Extended Supervision, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.

Defendant Johnny Fletcher in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Johnny Fletcher in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  At request of the parties, Court ordered PSI report.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Johnny Fletcher in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Johnny Fletcher in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Doctor's Report received and filed.  Doctor's report read by parties.  Parties do not dispute the findings and Court reinstates the proceedings. Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Doctor's Report received and filed.

State's Notice Of Intent To Call An Expert Witness received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

State's Witness List received and filed.
Clerk:  jms
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for 08-27-2015 at 08:30 a.m.  Jury trial scheduled for 10-21-2015 at 8:30 a.m.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Defendant Johnny Fletcher in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Johnny Fletcher in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel informs the Court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered proceedings suspended and defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Order For Competency Examination, signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit.  

Jury trial is vacated.  Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return and jury trial in Branch 40.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Johnny Fletcher in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Johnny Fletcher in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
JUDGE BOROWSKI FOR JUDGE DALLET.
Case set for plea hearing.  Court attempted to take the plea, but defendant did not admit responsibility.  At the request of the state, Court ordered matter adjourn for jury trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in court, defendant Johnny Fletcher not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for plea hearing.  Defendant has not seen the discovery yet and would like time to review it.  Court granted the request to adjourn.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in court, defendant Johnny Fletcher not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 04/04/2015 received and filed. (13 Pages)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Atty. Robert Taylor, 633 West Wisconsin Avenue, Suite 1901, Milwaukee, WI, 53203.

Defendant Johnny Fletcher in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Johnny Fletcher in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  City of Cudahy Police Detective Anthony Andrews.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LM dob 9/18/13 or Betty M. (LM's Mother)

Defendant Johnny Fletcher in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Johnny Fletcher in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Johnny Fletcher
Current: 2025 N 39th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208 United States  (Effective: 04-06-2015)
Prior: 5516 South Nicholson Avenue, Cudahy, WI 53110
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
